body_html:
Regarding "float" type. Right now "float32" default is hardcoded in almost every op (github search.

One could potentially factor it out. But right now so few ops support non-float32 type, I wonder if other types make sense as a default. For instance, right now convolution doesn't support float64.

Regarding having global session settings/run options, I think more details are needed of how the semantics of it would work.

body:
Regarding "float" type. Right now "float32" default is hardcoded in almost every op (github [search](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/search?p=3&q=%22dtype%3Dtf.float32%22&type=Code&utf8=%E2%9C%93).

One could potentially factor it out. But right now so few ops support non-float32 type, I wonder if other types make sense as a default. For instance, right now convolution doesn't support float64.

Regarding having global session settings/run options, I think more details are needed of how the semantics of it would work.
